content.raw:
I see, I mentioned it because of what the documentation says, and also because right now this seems to be the only way that the system can be updated.

Maybe registering a callback should be a system's internal implementation detail? We should be careful about providing too many interfaces, I remember from `gazebo_experimental` that keeping systems in sync was central to the `ecs::Manager`, and if we provide too many entry points for systems, we could have a hard time managing them all.
